2458 list_for_each_entry(smaller_ep, &interval_bw->endpoints,
2459 bw_endpoint_list) {
2460 if (ep_bw->max_packet_size >=
2461 smaller_ep->bw_info.max_packet_size) {
2462 /* Add the new ep before the smaller endpoint */
2463 list_add_tail(&virt_ep->bw_endpoint_list,
2464 &smaller_ep->bw_endpoint_list);
2465 return;
2466 }
2467 }
2468 /* Add the new endpoint at the end of the list. */
2469 list_add_tail(&virt_ep->bw_endpoint_list,
2470 &interval_bw->endpoints);
2471}
2472
2473void xhci_update_tt_active_eps(struct xhci_hcd *xhci,
2474 struct xhci_virt_device *virt_dev,
2475 int old_active_eps)
2476{
2477 struct xhci_root_port_bw_info *rh_bw_info;
2478 if (!virt_dev->tt_info)
2479 return;
2480
2481 rh_bw_info = &xhci->rh_bw[virt_dev->real_port - 1];
2482 if (old_active_eps == 0 &&
2483 virt_dev->tt_info->active_eps != 0) {
2484 rh_bw_info->num_active_tts += 1;
2485 rh_bw_info->bw_table.bw_used += TT_HS_OVERHEAD;
2486 } else if (old_active_eps != 0 &&
2487 virt_dev->tt_info->active_eps == 0) {
2488 rh_bw_info->num_active_tts -= 1;
2489 rh_bw_info->bw_table.bw_used -= TT_HS_OVERHEAD;
2490 }
2491}
2492
2493static int xhci_reserve_bandwidth(struct xhci_hcd *xhci,
2494 struct xhci_virt_device *virt_dev,
2495 struct xhci_container_ctx *in_ctx)
2496{
2497 struct xhci_bw_info ep_bw_info[31];
2498 int i;
2499 struct xhci_input_control_ctx *ctrl_ctx;
2500 int old_active_eps = 0;
2501
2502 if (virt_dev->tt_info)
2503 old_active_eps = virt_dev->tt_info->active_eps;
2504
2505 ctrl_ctx = xhci_get_input_control_ctx(in_ctx);
2506 if (!ctrl_ctx) {
2507 xhci_warn(xhci, "%s: Could not get input context, bad type.\n",
2508 __func__);
2509 return -ENOMEM;
2510 }
2511
2512 for (i = 0; i < 31; i++) {
2513 if (!EP_IS_ADDED(ctrl_ctx, i) && !EP_IS_DROPPED(ctrl_ctx, i))
2514 continue;
2515
2516 /* Make a copy of the BW info in case we need to revert this */
2517 memcpy(&ep_bw_info[i], &virt_dev->eps[i].bw_info,
2518 sizeof(ep_bw_info[i]));
2519 /* Drop the endpoint from the interval table if the endpoint is
2520 * being dropped or changed.
2521 */
2522 if (EP_IS_DROPPED(ctrl_ctx, i))
2523 xhci_drop_ep_from_interval_table(xhci,
2524 &virt_dev->eps[i].bw_info,
2525 virt_dev->bw_table,
2526 virt_dev->udev,
2527 &virt_dev->eps[i],
2528 virt_dev->tt_info);
2529 }
2530 /* Overwrite the information stored in the endpoints' bw_info */
2531 xhci_update_bw_info(xhci, virt_dev->in_ctx, ctrl_ctx, virt_dev);
2532 for (i = 0; i < 31; i++) {
2533 /* Add any changed or added endpoints to the interval table */
2534 if (EP_IS_ADDED(ctrl_ctx, i))
2535 xhci_add_ep_to_interval_table(xhci,
2536 &virt_dev->eps[i].bw_info,
2537 virt_dev->bw_table,
2538 virt_dev->udev,
2539 &virt_dev->eps[i],
2540 virt_dev->tt_info);
2541 }
2542
2543 if (!xhci_check_bw_table(xhci, virt_dev, old_active_eps)) {
2544 /* Ok, this fits in the bandwidth we have.
2545 * Update the number of active TTs.
2546 */
2547 xhci_update_tt_active_eps(xhci, virt_dev, old_active_eps);
2548 return 0;
2549 }
2550
2551 /* We don't have enough bandwidth for this, revert the stored info. */
2552 for (i = 0; i < 31; i++) {
2553 if (!EP_IS_ADDED(ctrl_ctx, i) && !EP_IS_DROPPED(ctrl_ctx, i))
2554 continue;
2555
2556 /* Drop the new copies of any added or changed endpoints from
2557 * the interval table.
2558 */
2559 if (EP_IS_ADDED(ctrl_ctx, i)) {
2560 xhci_drop_ep_from_interval_table(xhci,
2561 &virt_dev->eps[i].bw_info,
2562 virt_dev->bw_table,
2563 virt_dev->udev,
2564 &virt_dev->eps[i],
2565 virt_dev->tt_info);
2566 }
2567 /* Revert the endpoint back to its old information */
2568 memcpy(&virt_dev->eps[i].bw_info, &ep_bw_info[i],
2569 sizeof(ep_bw_info[i]));
2570 /* Add any changed or dropped endpoints back into the table */
2571 if (EP_IS_DROPPED(ctrl_ctx, i))
2572 xhci_add_ep_to_interval_table(xhci,
2573 &virt_dev->eps[i].bw_info,
2574 virt_dev->bw_table,
2575 virt_dev->udev,
2576 &virt_dev->eps[i],
2577 virt_dev->tt_info);
2578 }
2579 return -ENOMEM;
2580}
2581
2582
2583/* Issue a configure endpoint command or evaluate context command
2584 * and wait for it to finish.
2585 */
2586static int xhci_configure_endpoint(struct xhci_hcd *xhci,
2587 struct usb_device *udev,
2588 struct xhci_command *command,
2589 bool ctx_change, bool must_succeed)
2590{
2591 int ret;
2592 unsigned long flags;
2593 struct xhci_input_control_ctx *ctrl_ctx;
2594 struct xhci_virt_device *virt_dev;
2595
2596 if (!command)
2597 return -EINVAL;
2598
2599 spin_lock_irqsave(&xhci->lock, flags);
2600
2601 if (xhci->xhc_state & XHCI_STATE_DYING) {
2602 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
2603 return -ESHUTDOWN;
2604 }
2605
2606 virt_dev = xhci->devs[udev->slot_id];
2607
2608 ctrl_ctx = xhci_get_input_control_ctx(command->in_ctx);
2609 if (!ctrl_ctx) {
2610 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
2611 xhci_warn(xhci, "%s: Could not get input context, bad type.\n",
2612 __func__);
2613 return -ENOMEM;
2614 }
2615
2616 if ((xhci->quirks & XHCI_EP_LIMIT_QUIRK) &&
2617 xhci_reserve_host_resources(xhci, ctrl_ctx)) {
2618 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
2619 xhci_warn(xhci, "Not enough host resources, "
2620 "active endpoint contexts = %u\n",
2621 xhci->num_active_eps);
2622 return -ENOMEM;
2623 }
2624 if ((xhci->quirks & XHCI_SW_BW_CHECKING) &&
2625 xhci_reserve_bandwidth(xhci, virt_dev, command->in_ctx)) {
2626 if ((xhci->quirks & XHCI_EP_LIMIT_QUIRK))
2627 xhci_free_host_resources(xhci, ctrl_ctx);
2628 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
2629 xhci_warn(xhci, "Not enough bandwidth\n");
2630 return -ENOMEM;
2631 }
2632
2633 if (!ctx_change)
2634 ret = xhci_queue_configure_endpoint(xhci, command,
2635 command->in_ctx->dma,
2636 udev->slot_id, must_succeed);
2637 else
2638 ret = xhci_queue_evaluate_context(xhci, command,
2639 command->in_ctx->dma,
2640 udev->slot_id, must_succeed);
2641 if (ret < 0) {
2642 if ((xhci->quirks & XHCI_EP_LIMIT_QUIRK))
2643 xhci_free_host_resources(xhci, ctrl_ctx);
2644 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
2645 xhci_dbg_trace(xhci, trace_xhci_dbg_context_change,
2646 "FIXME allocate a new ring segment");
2647 return -ENOMEM;
2648 }
2649 xhci_ring_cmd_db(xhci);
2650 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
2651
2652 /* Wait for the configure endpoint command to complete */
2653 wait_for_completion(command->completion);
2654
2655 if (!ctx_change)
2656 ret = xhci_configure_endpoint_result(xhci, udev,
2657 &command->status);
2658 else
2659 ret = xhci_evaluate_context_result(xhci, udev,
2660 &command->status);
2661
2662 if ((xhci->quirks & XHCI_EP_LIMIT_QUIRK)) {
2663 spin_lock_irqsave(&xhci->lock, flags);
2664 /* If the command failed, remove the reserved resources.
2665 * Otherwise, clean up the estimate to include dropped eps.
2666 */
2667 if (ret)
2668 xhci_free_host_resources(xhci, ctrl_ctx);
2669 else
2670 xhci_finish_resource_reservation(xhci, ctrl_ctx);
2671 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
2672 }
2673 return ret;
2674}
2675
2676static void xhci_check_bw_drop_ep_streams(struct xhci_hcd *xhci,
2677 struct xhci_virt_device *vdev, int i)
2678{
2679 struct xhci_virt_ep *ep = &vdev->eps[i];
2680
2681 if (ep->ep_state & EP_HAS_STREAMS) {
2682 xhci_warn(xhci, "WARN: endpoint 0x%02x has streams on set_interface, freeing streams.\n",
2683 xhci_get_endpoint_address(i));
2684 xhci_free_stream_info(xhci, ep->stream_info);
2685 ep->stream_info = NULL;
2686 ep->ep_state &= ~EP_HAS_STREAMS;
2687 }
2688}
2689
2690/* Called after one or more calls to xhci_add_endpoint() or
2691 * xhci_drop_endpoint(). If this call fails, the USB core is expected
2692 * to call xhci_reset_bandwidth().
2693 *
2694 * Since we are in the middle of changing either configuration or
2695 * installing a new alt setting, the USB core won't allow URBs to be
2696 * enqueued for any endpoint on the old config or interface. Nothing
2697 * else should be touching the xhci->devs[slot_id] structure, so we
2698 * don't need to take the xhci->lock for manipulating that.
2699 */
2700static int xhci_check_bandwidth(struct usb_hcd *hcd, struct usb_device *udev)
2701{
2702 int i;
2703 int ret = 0;
2704 struct xhci_hcd *xhci;
2705 struct xhci_virt_device *virt_dev;
2706 struct xhci_input_control_ctx *ctrl_ctx;
2707 struct xhci_slot_ctx *slot_ctx;
2708 struct xhci_command *command;
2709
2710 ret = xhci_check_args(hcd, udev, NULL, 0, true, __func__);
2711 if (ret <= 0)
2712 return ret;
2713 xhci = hcd_to_xhci(hcd);
2714 if ((xhci->xhc_state & XHCI_STATE_DYING) ||
2715 (xhci->xhc_state & XHCI_STATE_REMOVING))
2716 return -ENODEV;
2717
2718 xhci_dbg(xhci, "%s called for udev %p\n", __func__, udev);
2719 virt_dev = xhci->devs[udev->slot_id];
2720
2721 command = xhci_alloc_command(xhci, false, true, GFP_KERNEL);
2722 if (!command)
2723 return -ENOMEM;
2724
2725 command->in_ctx = virt_dev->in_ctx;
2726
2727 /* See section 4.6.6 - A0 = 1; A1 = D0 = D1 = 0 */
2728 ctrl_ctx = xhci_get_input_control_ctx(command->in_ctx);
2729 if (!ctrl_ctx) {
2730 xhci_warn(xhci, "%s: Could not get input context, bad type.\n",
2731 __func__);
2732 ret = -ENOMEM;
2733 goto command_cleanup;
2734 }
2735 ctrl_ctx->add_flags |= cpu_to_le32(SLOT_FLAG);
2736 ctrl_ctx->add_flags &= cpu_to_le32(~EP0_FLAG);
2737 ctrl_ctx->drop_flags &= cpu_to_le32(~(SLOT_FLAG | EP0_FLAG));
2738
2739 /* Don't issue the command if there's no endpoints to update. */
2740 if (ctrl_ctx->add_flags == cpu_to_le32(SLOT_FLAG) &&
2741 ctrl_ctx->drop_flags == 0) {
2742 ret = 0;
2743 goto command_cleanup;
2744 }
2745 /* Fix up Context Entries field. Minimum value is EP0 == BIT(1). */
2746 slot_ctx = xhci_get_slot_ctx(xhci, virt_dev->in_ctx);
2747 for (i = 31; i >= 1; i--) {
2748 __le32 le32 = cpu_to_le32(BIT(i));
2749
2750 if ((virt_dev->eps[i-1].ring && !(ctrl_ctx->drop_flags & le32))
2751 || (ctrl_ctx->add_flags & le32) || i == 1) {
2752 slot_ctx->dev_info &= cpu_to_le32(~LAST_CTX_MASK);
2753 slot_ctx->dev_info |= cpu_to_le32(LAST_CTX(i));
2754 break;
2755 }
2756 }
2757
2758 ret = xhci_configure_endpoint(xhci, udev, command,
2759 false, false);
2760 if (ret)
2761 /* Callee should call reset_bandwidth() */
2762 goto command_cleanup;
2763
2764 /* Free any rings that were dropped, but not changed. */
2765 for (i = 1; i < 31; i++) {
2766 if ((le32_to_cpu(ctrl_ctx->drop_flags) & (1 << (i + 1))) &&
2767 !(le32_to_cpu(ctrl_ctx->add_flags) & (1 << (i + 1)))) {
2768 xhci_free_endpoint_ring(xhci, virt_dev, i);
2769 xhci_check_bw_drop_ep_streams(xhci, virt_dev, i);
2770 }
2771 }
2772 xhci_zero_in_ctx(xhci, virt_dev);
2773 /*
2774 * Install any rings for completely new endpoints or changed endpoints,
2775 * and free any old rings from changed endpoints.
2776 */
2777 for (i = 1; i < 31; i++) {
2778 if (!virt_dev->eps[i].new_ring)
2779 continue;
2780 /* Only free the old ring if it exists.
2781 * It may not if this is the first add of an endpoint.
2782 */
2783 if (virt_dev->eps[i].ring) {
2784 xhci_free_endpoint_ring(xhci, virt_dev, i);
2785 }
2786 xhci_check_bw_drop_ep_streams(xhci, virt_dev, i);
2787 virt_dev->eps[i].ring = virt_dev->eps[i].new_ring;
2788 virt_dev->eps[i].new_ring = NULL;
2789 }
2790command_cleanup:
2791 kfree(command->completion);
2792 kfree(command);
2793
2794 return ret;
2795}
2796
2797static void xhci_reset_bandwidth(struct usb_hcd *hcd, struct usb_device *udev)
2798{
2799 struct xhci_hcd *xhci;
2800 struct xhci_virt_device *virt_dev;
2801 int i, ret;
2802
2803 ret = xhci_check_args(hcd, udev, NULL, 0, true, __func__);
2804 if (ret <= 0)
2805 return;
2806 xhci = hcd_to_xhci(hcd);
2807
2808 xhci_dbg(xhci, "%s called for udev %p\n", __func__, udev);
2809 virt_dev = xhci->devs[udev->slot_id];
2810 /* Free any rings allocated for added endpoints */
2811 for (i = 0; i < 31; i++) {
2812 if (virt_dev->eps[i].new_ring) {
2813 xhci_ring_free(xhci, virt_dev->eps[i].new_ring);
2814 virt_dev->eps[i].new_ring = NULL;
2815 }
2816 }
2817 xhci_zero_in_ctx(xhci, virt_dev);
2818}
2819
2820static void xhci_setup_input_ctx_for_config_ep(struct xhci_hcd *xhci,
2821 struct xhci_container_ctx *in_ctx,
2822 struct xhci_container_ctx *out_ctx,
2823 struct xhci_input_control_ctx *ctrl_ctx,
2824 u32 add_flags, u32 drop_flags)
2825{
2826 ctrl_ctx->add_flags = cpu_to_le32(add_flags);
2827 ctrl_ctx->drop_flags = cpu_to_le32(drop_flags);
2828 xhci_slot_copy(xhci, in_ctx, out_ctx);
2829 ctrl_ctx->add_flags |= cpu_to_le32(SLOT_FLAG);
2830}
2831
2832static void xhci_setup_input_ctx_for_quirk(struct xhci_hcd *xhci,
2833 unsigned int slot_id, unsigned int ep_index,
2834 struct xhci_dequeue_state *deq_state)
2835{
2836 struct xhci_input_control_ctx *ctrl_ctx;
2837 struct xhci_container_ctx *in_ctx;
2838 struct xhci_ep_ctx *ep_ctx;
2839 u32 added_ctxs;
2840 dma_addr_t addr;
2841
2842 in_ctx = xhci->devs[slot_id]->in_ctx;
2843 ctrl_ctx = xhci_get_input_control_ctx(in_ctx);
2844 if (!ctrl_ctx) {
2845 xhci_warn(xhci, "%s: Could not get input context, bad type.\n",
2846 __func__);
2847 return;
2848 }
2849
2850 xhci_endpoint_copy(xhci, xhci->devs[slot_id]->in_ctx,
2851 xhci->devs[slot_id]->out_ctx, ep_index);
2852 ep_ctx = xhci_get_ep_ctx(xhci, in_ctx, ep_index);
2853 addr = xhci_trb_virt_to_dma(deq_state->new_deq_seg,
2854 deq_state->new_deq_ptr);
2855 if (addr == 0) {
2856 xhci_warn(xhci, "WARN Cannot submit config ep after "
2857 "reset ep command\n");
2858 xhci_warn(xhci, "WARN deq seg = %p, deq ptr = %p\n",
2859 deq_state->new_deq_seg,
2860 deq_state->new_deq_ptr);
2861 return;
2862 }
2863 ep_ctx->deq = cpu_to_le64(addr | deq_state->new_cycle_state);
2864
2865 added_ctxs = xhci_get_endpoint_flag_from_index(ep_index);
2866 xhci_setup_input_ctx_for_config_ep(xhci, xhci->devs[slot_id]->in_ctx,
2867 xhci->devs[slot_id]->out_ctx, ctrl_ctx,
2868 added_ctxs, added_ctxs);
2869}
2870
2871void xhci_cleanup_stalled_ring(struct xhci_hcd *xhci, unsigned int ep_index,
2872 unsigned int stream_id, struct xhci_td *td)
2873{
2874 struct xhci_dequeue_state deq_state;
2875 struct xhci_virt_ep *ep;
2876 struct usb_device *udev = td->urb->dev;
2877
2878 xhci_dbg_trace(xhci, trace_xhci_dbg_reset_ep,
2879 "Cleaning up stalled endpoint ring");
2880 ep = &xhci->devs[udev->slot_id]->eps[ep_index];
2881 /* We need to move the HW's dequeue pointer past this TD,
2882 * or it will attempt to resend it on the next doorbell ring.
2883 */
2884 xhci_find_new_dequeue_state(xhci, udev->slot_id,
2885 ep_index, stream_id, td, &deq_state);
2886
2887 if (!deq_state.new_deq_ptr || !deq_state.new_deq_seg)
2888 return;
2889
2890 /* HW with the reset endpoint quirk will use the saved dequeue state to
2891 * issue a configure endpoint command later.
2892 */
2893 if (!(xhci->quirks & XHCI_RESET_EP_QUIRK)) {
2894 xhci_dbg_trace(xhci, trace_xhci_dbg_reset_ep,
2895 "Queueing new dequeue state");
2896 xhci_queue_new_dequeue_state(xhci, udev->slot_id,
2897 ep_index, &deq_state);
2898 } else {
2899 /* Better hope no one uses the input context between now and the
2900 * reset endpoint completion!
2901 * XXX: No idea how this hardware will react when stream rings
2902 * are enabled.
2903 */
2904 xhci_dbg_trace(xhci, trace_xhci_dbg_quirks,
2905 "Setting up input context for "
2906 "configure endpoint command");
2907 xhci_setup_input_ctx_for_quirk(xhci, udev->slot_id,
2908 ep_index, &deq_state);
2909 }
2910}
2911
2912/* Called when clearing halted device. The core should have sent the control
2913 * message to clear the device halt condition. The host side of the halt should
2914 * already be cleared with a reset endpoint command issued when the STALL tx
2915 * event was received.
2916 *
2917 * Context: in_interrupt
2918 */
2919
2920static void xhci_endpoint_reset(struct usb_hcd *hcd,
2921 struct usb_host_endpoint *ep)
2922{
2923 struct xhci_hcd *xhci;
2924
2925 xhci = hcd_to_xhci(hcd);
2926
2927 /*
2928 * We might need to implement the config ep cmd in xhci 4.8.1 note:
2929 * The Reset Endpoint Command may only be issued to endpoints in the
2930 * Halted state. If software wishes reset the Data Toggle or Sequence
2931 * Number of an endpoint that isn't in the Halted state, then software
2932 * may issue a Configure Endpoint Command with the Drop and Add bits set
2933 * for the target endpoint. that is in the Stopped state.
2934 */
2935
2936 /* For now just print debug to follow the situation */
2937 xhci_dbg(xhci, "Endpoint 0x%x ep reset callback called\n",
2938 ep->desc.bEndpointAddress);
2939}
2940
2941static int xhci_check_streams_endpoint(struct xhci_hcd *xhci,
2942 struct usb_device *udev, struct usb_host_endpoint *ep,
2943 unsigned int slot_id)
2944{
2945 int ret;
2946 unsigned int ep_index;
2947 unsigned int ep_state;
2948
2949 if (!ep)
2950 return -EINVAL;
2951 ret = xhci_check_args(xhci_to_hcd(xhci), udev, ep, 1, true, __func__);
2952 if (ret <= 0)
2953 return -EINVAL;
2954 if (usb_ss_max_streams(&ep->ss_ep_comp) == 0) {
2955 xhci_warn(xhci, "WARN: SuperSpeed Endpoint Companion"
2956 " descriptor for ep 0x%x does not support streams\n",
2957 ep->desc.bEndpointAddress);
2958 return -EINVAL;
2959 }
2960
2961 ep_index = xhci_get_endpoint_index(&ep->desc);
2962 ep_state = xhci->devs[slot_id]->eps[ep_index].ep_state;
2963 if (ep_state & EP_HAS_STREAMS ||
2964 ep_state & EP_GETTING_STREAMS) {
2965 xhci_warn(xhci, "WARN: SuperSpeed bulk endpoint 0x%x "
2966 "already has streams set up.\n",
2967 ep->desc.bEndpointAddress);
2968 xhci_warn(xhci, "Send email to xHCI maintainer and ask for "
2969 "dynamic stream context array reallocation.\n");
2970 return -EINVAL;
2971 }
2972 if (!list_empty(&xhci->devs[slot_id]->eps[ep_index].ring->td_list)) {
2973 xhci_warn(xhci, "Cannot setup streams for SuperSpeed bulk "
2974 "endpoint 0x%x; URBs are pending.\n",
2975 ep->desc.bEndpointAddress);
2976 return -EINVAL;
2977 }
2978 return 0;
2979}
2980
2981static void xhci_calculate_streams_entries(struct xhci_hcd *xhci,
2982 unsigned int *num_streams, unsigned int *num_stream_ctxs)
2983{
2984 unsigned int max_streams;
2985
2986 /* The stream context array size must be a power of two */
2987 *num_stream_ctxs = roundup_pow_of_two(*num_streams);
2988 /*
2989 * Find out how many primary stream array entries the host controller
2990 * supports. Later we may use secondary stream arrays (similar to 2nd
2991 * level page entries), but that's an optional feature for xHCI host
2992 * controllers. xHCs must support at least 4 stream IDs.
2993 */
2994 max_streams = HCC_MAX_PSA(xhci->hcc_params);
2995 if (*num_stream_ctxs > max_streams) {
2996 xhci_dbg(xhci, "xHCI HW only supports %u stream ctx entries.\n",
2997 max_streams);
2998 *num_stream_ctxs = max_streams;
2999 *num_streams = max_streams;
3000 }
3001}
3002
3003/* Returns an error code if one of the endpoint already has streams.
3004 * This does not change any data structures, it only checks and gathers
3005 * information.
3006 */
3007static int xhci_calculate_streams_and_bitmask(struct xhci_hcd *xhci,
3008 struct usb_device *udev,
3009 struct usb_host_endpoint **eps, unsigned int num_eps,
3010 unsigned int *num_streams, u32 *changed_ep_bitmask)
3011{
3012 unsigned int max_streams;
3013 unsigned int endpoint_flag;
3014 int i;
3015 int ret;
3016
3017 for (i = 0; i < num_eps; i++) {
3018 ret = xhci_check_streams_endpoint(xhci, udev,
3019 eps[i], udev->slot_id);
3020 if (ret < 0)
3021 return ret;
3022
3023 max_streams = usb_ss_max_streams(&eps[i]->ss_ep_comp);
3024 if (max_streams < (*num_streams - 1)) {
3025 xhci_dbg(xhci, "Ep 0x%x only supports %u stream IDs.\n",
3026 eps[i]->desc.bEndpointAddress,
3027 max_streams);
3028 *num_streams = max_streams+1;
3029 }
3030
3031 endpoint_flag = xhci_get_endpoint_flag(&eps[i]->desc);
3032 if (*changed_ep_bitmask & endpoint_flag)
3033 return -EINVAL;
3034 *changed_ep_bitmask |= endpoint_flag;
3035 }
3036 return 0;
3037}
3038
3039static u32 xhci_calculate_no_streams_bitmask(struct xhci_hcd *xhci,
3040 struct usb_device *udev,
3041 struct usb_host_endpoint **eps, unsigned int num_eps)
3042{
3043 u32 changed_ep_bitmask = 0;
3044 unsigned int slot_id;
3045 unsigned int ep_index;
3046 unsigned int ep_state;
3047 int i;
3048
3049 slot_id = udev->slot_id;
3050 if (!xhci->devs[slot_id])
3051 return 0;
3052
3053 for (i = 0; i < num_eps; i++) {
3054 ep_index = xhci_get_endpoint_index(&eps[i]->desc);
3055 ep_state = xhci->devs[slot_id]->eps[ep_index].ep_state;
3056 /* Are streams already being freed for the endpoint? */
3057 if (ep_state & EP_GETTING_NO_STREAMS) {
3058 xhci_warn(xhci, "WARN Can't disable streams for "
3059 "endpoint 0x%x, "
3060 "streams are being disabled already\n",
3061 eps[i]->desc.bEndpointAddress);
3062 return 0;
3063 }
3064 /* Are there actually any streams to free? */
3065 if (!(ep_state & EP_HAS_STREAMS) &&
3066 !(ep_state & EP_GETTING_STREAMS)) {
3067 xhci_warn(xhci, "WARN Can't disable streams for "
3068 "endpoint 0x%x, "
3069 "streams are already disabled!\n",
3070 eps[i]->desc.bEndpointAddress);
3071 xhci_warn(xhci, "WARN xhci_free_streams() called "
3072 "with non-streams endpoint\n");
3073 return 0;
3074 }
3075 changed_ep_bitmask |= xhci_get_endpoint_flag(&eps[i]->desc);
3076 }
3077 return changed_ep_bitmask;
3078}
3079
3080/*
3081 * The USB device drivers use this function (through the HCD interface in USB
3082 * core) to prepare a set of bulk endpoints to use streams. Streams are used to
3083 * coordinate mass storage command queueing across multiple endpoints (basically
3084 * a stream ID == a task ID).
3085 *
3086 * Setting up streams involves allocating the same size stream context array
3087 * for each endpoint and issuing a configure endpoint command for all endpoints.
3088 *
3089 * Don't allow the call to succeed if one endpoint only supports one stream
3090 * (which means it doesn't support streams at all).
3091 *
3092 * Drivers may get less stream IDs than they asked for, if the host controller
3093 * hardware or endpoints claim they can't support the number of requested
3094 * stream IDs.
3095 */
3096static int xhci_alloc_streams(struct usb_hcd *hcd, struct usb_device *udev,
3097 struct usb_host_endpoint **eps, unsigned int num_eps,
3098 unsigned int num_streams, gfp_t mem_flags)
3099{
3100 int i, ret;
3101 struct xhci_hcd *xhci;
3102 struct xhci_virt_device *vdev;
3103 struct xhci_command *config_cmd;
3104 struct xhci_input_control_ctx *ctrl_ctx;
3105 unsigned int ep_index;
3106 unsigned int num_stream_ctxs;
3107 unsigned int max_packet;
3108 unsigned long flags;
3109 u32 changed_ep_bitmask = 0;
3110
3111 if (!eps)
3112 return -EINVAL;
3113
3114 /* Add one to the number of streams requested to account for
3115 * stream 0 that is reserved for xHCI usage.
3116 */
3117 num_streams += 1;
3118 xhci = hcd_to_xhci(hcd);
3119 xhci_dbg(xhci, "Driver wants %u stream IDs (including stream 0).\n",
3120 num_streams);
3121
3122 /* MaxPSASize value 0 (2 streams) means streams are not supported */
3123 if ((xhci->quirks & XHCI_BROKEN_STREAMS) ||
3124 HCC_MAX_PSA(xhci->hcc_params) < 4) {
3125 xhci_dbg(xhci, "xHCI controller does not support streams.\n");
3126 return -ENOSYS;
3127 }
3128
3129 config_cmd = xhci_alloc_command(xhci, true, true, mem_flags);
3130 if (!config_cmd)
3131 return -ENOMEM;
3132
3133 ctrl_ctx = xhci_get_input_control_ctx(config_cmd->in_ctx);
3134 if (!ctrl_ctx) {
3135 xhci_warn(xhci, "%s: Could not get input context, bad type.\n",
3136 __func__);
3137 xhci_free_command(xhci, config_cmd);
3138 return -ENOMEM;
3139 }
3140
3141 /* Check to make sure all endpoints are not already configured for
3142 * streams. While we're at it, find the maximum number of streams that
3143 * all the endpoints will support and check for duplicate endpoints.
3144 */
3145 spin_lock_irqsave(&xhci->lock, flags);
3146 ret = xhci_calculate_streams_and_bitmask(xhci, udev, eps,
3147 num_eps, &num_streams, &changed_ep_bitmask);
3148 if (ret < 0) {
3149 xhci_free_command(xhci, config_cmd);
3150 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
3151 return ret;
3152 }
3153 if (num_streams <= 1) {
3154 xhci_warn(xhci, "WARN: endpoints can't handle "
3155 "more than one stream.\n");
3156 xhci_free_command(xhci, config_cmd);
3157 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
3158 return -EINVAL;
3159 }
3160 vdev = xhci->devs[udev->slot_id];
3161 /* Mark each endpoint as being in transition, so
3162 * xhci_urb_enqueue() will reject all URBs.
3163 */
3164 for (i = 0; i < num_eps; i++) {
3165 ep_index = xhci_get_endpoint_index(&eps[i]->desc);
3166 vdev->eps[ep_index].ep_state |= EP_GETTING_STREAMS;
3167 }
3168 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
3169
3170 /* Setup internal data structures and allocate HW data structures for
3171 * streams (but don't install the HW structures in the input context
3172 * until we're sure all memory allocation succeeded).
3173 */
3174 xhci_calculate_streams_entries(xhci, &num_streams, &num_stream_ctxs);
3175 xhci_dbg(xhci, "Need %u stream ctx entries for %u stream IDs.\n",
3176 num_stream_ctxs, num_streams);
3177
3178 for (i = 0; i < num_eps; i++) {
3179 ep_index = xhci_get_endpoint_index(&eps[i]->desc);
3180 max_packet = usb_endpoint_maxp(&eps[i]->desc);
3181 vdev->eps[ep_index].stream_info = xhci_alloc_stream_info(xhci,
3182 num_stream_ctxs,
3183 num_streams,
3184 max_packet, mem_flags);
3185 if (!vdev->eps[ep_index].stream_info)
3186 goto cleanup;
3187 /* Set maxPstreams in endpoint context and update deq ptr to
3188 * point to stream context array. FIXME
3189 */
3190 }
3191
3192 /* Set up the input context for a configure endpoint command. */
3193 for (i = 0; i < num_eps; i++) {
3194 struct xhci_ep_ctx *ep_ctx;
3195
3196 ep_index = xhci_get_endpoint_index(&eps[i]->desc);
3197 ep_ctx = xhci_get_ep_ctx(xhci, config_cmd->in_ctx, ep_index);
3198
3199 xhci_endpoint_copy(xhci, config_cmd->in_ctx,
3200 vdev->out_ctx, ep_index);
3201 xhci_setup_streams_ep_input_ctx(xhci, ep_ctx,
3202 vdev->eps[ep_index].stream_info);
3203 }
3204 /* Tell the HW to drop its old copy of the endpoint context info
3205 * and add the updated copy from the input context.
3206 */
3207 xhci_setup_input_ctx_for_config_ep(xhci, config_cmd->in_ctx,
3208 vdev->out_ctx, ctrl_ctx,
3209 changed_ep_bitmask, changed_ep_bitmask);
3210
3211 /* Issue and wait for the configure endpoint command */
3212 ret = xhci_configure_endpoint(xhci, udev, config_cmd,
3213 false, false);
3214
3215 /* xHC rejected the configure endpoint command for some reason, so we
3216 * leave the old ring intact and free our internal streams data
3217 * structure.
3218 */
3219 if (ret < 0)
3220 goto cleanup;
3221
3222 spin_lock_irqsave(&xhci->lock, flags);
3223 for (i = 0; i < num_eps; i++) {
3224 ep_index = xhci_get_endpoint_index(&eps[i]->desc);
3225 vdev->eps[ep_index].ep_state &= ~EP_GETTING_STREAMS;
3226 xhci_dbg(xhci, "Slot %u ep ctx %u now has streams.\n",
3227 udev->slot_id, ep_index);
3228 vdev->eps[ep_index].ep_state |= EP_HAS_STREAMS;
3229 }
3230 xhci_free_command(xhci, config_cmd);
3231 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
3232
3233 /* Subtract 1 for stream 0, which drivers can't use */
3234 return num_streams - 1;
3235
3236cleanup:
3237 /* If it didn't work, free the streams! */
3238 for (i = 0; i < num_eps; i++) {
3239 ep_index = xhci_get_endpoint_index(&eps[i]->desc);
3240 xhci_free_stream_info(xhci, vdev->eps[ep_index].stream_info);
3241 vdev->eps[ep_index].stream_info = NULL;
3242 /* FIXME Unset maxPstreams in endpoint context and
3243 * update deq ptr to point to normal string ring.
3244 */
3245 vdev->eps[ep_index].ep_state &= ~EP_GETTING_STREAMS;
3246 vdev->eps[ep_index].ep_state &= ~EP_HAS_STREAMS;
3247 xhci_endpoint_zero(xhci, vdev, eps[i]);
3248 }
3249 xhci_free_command(xhci, config_cmd);
3250 return -ENOMEM;
3251}
3252
3253/* Transition the endpoint from using streams to being a "normal" endpoint
3254 * without streams.
3255 *
3256 * Modify the endpoint context state, submit a configure endpoint command,
3257 * and free all endpoint rings for streams if that completes successfully.
3258 */
3259static int xhci_free_streams(struct usb_hcd *hcd, struct usb_device *udev,
3260 struct usb_host_endpoint **eps, unsigned int num_eps,
3261 gfp_t mem_flags)
3262{
3263 int i, ret;
3264 struct xhci_hcd *xhci;
3265 struct xhci_virt_device *vdev;
3266 struct xhci_command *command;
3267 struct xhci_input_control_ctx *ctrl_ctx;
3268 unsigned int ep_index;
3269 unsigned long flags;
3270 u32 changed_ep_bitmask;
3271
3272 xhci = hcd_to_xhci(hcd);
3273 vdev = xhci->devs[udev->slot_id];
3274
3275 /* Set up a configure endpoint command to remove the streams rings */
3276 spin_lock_irqsave(&xhci->lock, flags);
3277 changed_ep_bitmask = xhci_calculate_no_streams_bitmask(xhci,
3278 udev, eps, num_eps);
3279 if (changed_ep_bitmask == 0) {
3280 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
3281 return -EINVAL;
3282 }
3283
3284 /* Use the xhci_command structure from the first endpoint. We may have
3285 * allocated too many, but the driver may call xhci_free_streams() for
3286 * each endpoint it grouped into one call to xhci_alloc_streams().
3287 */
3288 ep_index = xhci_get_endpoint_index(&eps[0]->desc);
3289 command = vdev->eps[ep_index].stream_info->free_streams_command;
3290 ctrl_ctx = xhci_get_input_control_ctx(command->in_ctx);
3291 if (!ctrl_ctx) {
3292 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
3293 xhci_warn(xhci, "%s: Could not get input context, bad type.\n",
3294 __func__);
3295 return -EINVAL;
3296 }
3297
3298 for (i = 0; i < num_eps; i++) {
3299 struct xhci_ep_ctx *ep_ctx;
3300
3301 ep_index = xhci_get_endpoint_index(&eps[i]->desc);
3302 ep_ctx = xhci_get_ep_ctx(xhci, command->in_ctx, ep_index);
3303 xhci->devs[udev->slot_id]->eps[ep_index].ep_state |=
3304 EP_GETTING_NO_STREAMS;
3305
3306 xhci_endpoint_copy(xhci, command->in_ctx,
3307 vdev->out_ctx, ep_index);
3308 xhci_setup_no_streams_ep_input_ctx(ep_ctx,
3309 &vdev->eps[ep_index]);
3310 }
3311 xhci_setup_input_ctx_for_config_ep(xhci, command->in_ctx,
3312 vdev->out_ctx, ctrl_ctx,
3313 changed_ep_bitmask, changed_ep_bitmask);
3314 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
3315
3316 /* Issue and wait for the configure endpoint command,
3317 * which must succeed.
3318 */
3319 ret = xhci_configure_endpoint(xhci, udev, command,
3320 false, true);
3321
3322 /* xHC rejected the configure endpoint command for some reason, so we
3323 * leave the streams rings intact.
3324 */
3325 if (ret < 0)
3326 return ret;
3327
3328 spin_lock_irqsave(&xhci->lock, flags);
3329 for (i = 0; i < num_eps; i++) {
3330 ep_index = xhci_get_endpoint_index(&eps[i]->desc);
3331 xhci_free_stream_info(xhci, vdev->eps[ep_index].stream_info);
3332 vdev->eps[ep_index].stream_info = NULL;
3333 /* FIXME Unset maxPstreams in endpoint context and
3334 * update deq ptr to point to normal string ring.
3335 */
3336 vdev->eps[ep_index].ep_state &= ~EP_GETTING_NO_STREAMS;
3337 vdev->eps[ep_index].ep_state &= ~EP_HAS_STREAMS;
3338 }
3339 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
3340
3341 return 0;
3342}
3343
3344/*
3345 * Deletes endpoint resources for endpoints that were active before a Reset
3346 * Device command, or a Disable Slot command. The Reset Device command leaves
3347 * the control endpoint intact, whereas the Disable Slot command deletes it.
3348 *
3349 * Must be called with xhci->lock held.
3350 */
3351void xhci_free_device_endpoint_resources(struct xhci_hcd *xhci,
3352 struct xhci_virt_device *virt_dev, bool drop_control_ep)
3353{
3354 int i;
3355 unsigned int num_dropped_eps = 0;
3356 unsigned int drop_flags = 0;
3357
3358 for (i = (drop_control_ep ? 0 : 1); i < 31; i++) {
3359 if (virt_dev->eps[i].ring) {
3360 drop_flags |= 1 << i;
3361 num_dropped_eps++;
3362 }
3363 }
3364 xhci->num_active_eps -= num_dropped_eps;
3365 if (num_dropped_eps)
3366 xhci_dbg_trace(xhci, trace_xhci_dbg_quirks,
3367 "Dropped %u ep ctxs, flags = 0x%x, "
3368 "%u now active.",
3369 num_dropped_eps, drop_flags,
3370 xhci->num_active_eps);
3371}
3372
3373/*
3374 * This submits a Reset Device Command, which will set the device state to 0,
3375 * set the device address to 0, and disable all the endpoints except the default
3376 * control endpoint. The USB core should come back and call
3377 * xhci_address_device(), and then re-set up the configuration. If this is
3378 * called because of a usb_reset_and_verify_device(), then the old alternate
3379 * settings will be re-installed through the normal bandwidth allocation
3380 * functions.
3381 *
3382 * Wait for the Reset Device command to finish. Remove all structures
3383 * associated with the endpoints that were disabled. Clear the input device
3384 * structure? Reset the control endpoint 0 max packet size?
3385 *
3386 * If the virt_dev to be reset does not exist or does not match the udev,
3387 * it means the device is lost, possibly due to the xHC restore error and
3388 * re-initialization during S3/S4. In this case, call xhci_alloc_dev() to
3389 * re-allocate the device.
3390 */
3391static int xhci_discover_or_reset_device(struct usb_hcd *hcd,
3392 struct usb_device *udev)
3393{
3394 int ret, i;
3395 unsigned long flags;
3396 struct xhci_hcd *xhci;
3397 unsigned int slot_id;
3398 struct xhci_virt_device *virt_dev;
3399 struct xhci_command *reset_device_cmd;
3400 int last_freed_endpoint;
3401 struct xhci_slot_ctx *slot_ctx;
3402 int old_active_eps = 0;
3403
3404 ret = xhci_check_args(hcd, udev, NULL, 0, false, __func__);
3405 if (ret <= 0)
3406 return ret;
3407 xhci = hcd_to_xhci(hcd);
3408 slot_id = udev->slot_id;
3409 virt_dev = xhci->devs[slot_id];
3410 if (!virt_dev) {
3411 xhci_dbg(xhci, "The device to be reset with slot ID %u does "
3412 "not exist. Re-allocate the device\n", slot_id);
3413 ret = xhci_alloc_dev(hcd, udev);
3414 if (ret == 1)
3415 return 0;
3416 else
3417 return -EINVAL;
3418 }
3419
3420 if (virt_dev->tt_info)
3421 old_active_eps = virt_dev->tt_info->active_eps;
3422
3423 if (virt_dev->udev != udev) {
3424 /* If the virt_dev and the udev does not match, this virt_dev
3425 * may belong to another udev.
3426 * Re-allocate the device.
3427 */
3428 xhci_dbg(xhci, "The device to be reset with slot ID %u does "
3429 "not match the udev. Re-allocate the device\n",
3430 slot_id);
3431 ret = xhci_alloc_dev(hcd, udev);
3432 if (ret == 1)
3433 return 0;
3434 else
3435 return -EINVAL;
3436 }
3437
3438 /* If device is not setup, there is no point in resetting it */
3439 slot_ctx = xhci_get_slot_ctx(xhci, virt_dev->out_ctx);
3440 if (GET_SLOT_STATE(le32_to_cpu(slot_ctx->dev_state)) ==
3441 SLOT_STATE_DISABLED)
3442 return 0;
3443
3444 trace_xhci_discover_or_reset_device(slot_ctx);
3445
3446 xhci_dbg(xhci, "Resetting device with slot ID %u\n", slot_id);
3447 /* Allocate the command structure that holds the struct completion.
3448 * Assume we're in process context, since the normal device reset
3449 * process has to wait for the device anyway. Storage devices are
3450 * reset as part of error handling, so use GFP_NOIO instead of
3451 * GFP_KERNEL.
3452 */
3453 reset_device_cmd = xhci_alloc_command(xhci, false, true, GFP_NOIO);
3454 if (!reset_device_cmd) {
3455 xhci_dbg(xhci, "Couldn't allocate command structure.\n");
3456 return -ENOMEM;
3457 }
3458
3459 /* Attempt to submit the Reset Device command to the command ring */
3460 spin_lock_irqsave(&xhci->lock, flags);
3461
3462 ret = xhci_queue_reset_device(xhci, reset_device_cmd, slot_id);
3463 if (ret) {
3464 xhci_dbg(xhci, "FIXME: allocate a command ring segment\n");
3465 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
3466 goto command_cleanup;
3467 }
3468 xhci_ring_cmd_db(xhci);
3469 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
3470
3471 /* Wait for the Reset Device command to finish */
3472 wait_for_completion(reset_device_cmd->completion);
3473
3474 /* The Reset Device command can't fail, according to the 0.95/0.96 spec,
3475 * unless we tried to reset a slot ID that wasn't enabled,
3476 * or the device wasn't in the addressed or configured state.
3477 */
3478 ret = reset_device_cmd->status;
3479 switch (ret) {
3480 case COMP_COMMAND_ABORTED:
3481 case COMP_COMMAND_RING_STOPPED:
3482 xhci_warn(xhci, "Timeout waiting for reset device command\n");
3483 ret = -ETIME;
3484 goto command_cleanup;
3485 case COMP_SLOT_NOT_ENABLED_ERROR: /* 0.95 completion for bad slot ID */
3486 case COMP_CONTEXT_STATE_ERROR: /* 0.96 completion code for same thing */
3487 xhci_dbg(xhci, "Can't reset device (slot ID %u) in %s state\n",
3488 slot_id,
3489 xhci_get_slot_state(xhci, virt_dev->out_ctx));
3490 xhci_dbg(xhci, "Not freeing device rings.\n");
3491 /* Don't treat this as an error. May change my mind later. */
3492 ret = 0;
3493 goto command_cleanup;
3494 case COMP_SUCCESS:
3495 xhci_dbg(xhci, "Successful reset device command.\n");
3496 break;
3497 default:
3498 if (xhci_is_vendor_info_code(xhci, ret))
3499 break;
3500 xhci_warn(xhci, "Unknown completion code %u for "
3501 "reset device command.\n", ret);
3502 ret = -EINVAL;
3503 goto command_cleanup;
3504 }
3505
3506 /* Free up host controller endpoint resources */
3507 if ((xhci->quirks & XHCI_EP_LIMIT_QUIRK)) {
3508 spin_lock_irqsave(&xhci->lock, flags);
3509 /* Don't delete the default control endpoint resources */
3510 xhci_free_device_endpoint_resources(xhci, virt_dev, false);
3511 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
3512 }
3513
3514 /* Everything but endpoint 0 is disabled, so free the rings. */
3515 last_freed_endpoint = 1;
3516 for (i = 1; i < 31; i++) {
3517 struct xhci_virt_ep *ep = &virt_dev->eps[i];
3518
3519 if (ep->ep_state & EP_HAS_STREAMS) {
3520 xhci_warn(xhci, "WARN: endpoint 0x%02x has streams on device reset, freeing streams.\n",
3521 xhci_get_endpoint_address(i));
3522 xhci_free_stream_info(xhci, ep->stream_info);
3523 ep->stream_info = NULL;
3524 ep->ep_state &= ~EP_HAS_STREAMS;
3525 }
3526
3527 if (ep->ring) {
3528 xhci_free_endpoint_ring(xhci, virt_dev, i);
3529 last_freed_endpoint = i;
3530 }
3531 if (!list_empty(&virt_dev->eps[i].bw_endpoint_list))
3532 xhci_drop_ep_from_interval_table(xhci,
3533 &virt_dev->eps[i].bw_info,
3534 virt_dev->bw_table,
3535 udev,
3536 &virt_dev->eps[i],
3537 virt_dev->tt_info);
3538 xhci_clear_endpoint_bw_info(&virt_dev->eps[i].bw_info);
3539 }
3540 /* If necessary, update the number of active TTs on this root port */
3541 xhci_update_tt_active_eps(xhci, virt_dev, old_active_eps);
3542 ret = 0;
3543
3544command_cleanup:
3545 xhci_free_command(xhci, reset_device_cmd);
3546 return ret;
3547}
3548
3549/*
3550 * At this point, the struct usb_device is about to go away, the device has
3551 * disconnected, and all traffic has been stopped and the endpoints have been
3552 * disabled. Free any HC data structures associated with that device.
3553 */
3554static void xhci_free_dev(struct usb_hcd *hcd, struct usb_device *udev)
3555{
3556 struct xhci_hcd *xhci = hcd_to_xhci(hcd);
3557 struct xhci_virt_device *virt_dev;
3558 struct xhci_slot_ctx *slot_ctx;
3559 int i, ret;
3560
3561#ifndef CONFIG_USB_DEFAULT_PERSIST
3562 /*
3563 * We called pm_runtime_get_noresume when the device was attached.
3564 * Decrement the counter here to allow controller to runtime suspend
3565 * if no devices remain.
3566 */
3567 if (xhci->quirks & XHCI_RESET_ON_RESUME)
3568 pm_runtime_put_noidle(hcd->self.controller);
3569#endif
3570
3571 ret = xhci_check_args(hcd, udev, NULL, 0, true, __func__);
3572 /* If the host is halted due to driver unload, we still need to free the
3573 * device.
3574 */
3575 if (ret <= 0 && ret != -ENODEV)
3576 return;
3577
3578 virt_dev = xhci->devs[udev->slot_id];
3579 slot_ctx = xhci_get_slot_ctx(xhci, virt_dev->out_ctx);
3580 trace_xhci_free_dev(slot_ctx);
3581
3582 /* Stop any wayward timer functions (which may grab the lock) */
3583 for (i = 0; i < 31; i++) {
3584 virt_dev->eps[i].ep_state &= ~EP_STOP_CMD_PENDING;
3585 del_timer_sync(&virt_dev->eps[i].stop_cmd_timer);
3586 }
3587
3588 virt_dev->udev = NULL;
3589 xhci_disable_slot(xhci, udev->slot_id);
3590 /*
3591 * Event command completion handler will free any data structures
3592 * associated with the slot. XXX Can free sleep?
3593 */
3594}
3595
3596int xhci_disable_slot(struct xhci_hcd *xhci, u32 slot_id)
3597{
3598 struct xhci_command *command;
3599 unsigned long flags;
3600 u32 state;
3601 int ret = 0;
3602
3603 command = xhci_alloc_command(xhci, false, false, GFP_KERNEL);
3604 if (!command)
3605 return -ENOMEM;
3606
3607 spin_lock_irqsave(&xhci->lock, flags);
3608 /* Don't disable the slot if the host controller is dead. */
3609 state = readl(&xhci->op_regs->status);
3610 if (state == 0xffffffff || (xhci->xhc_state & XHCI_STATE_DYING) ||
3611 (xhci->xhc_state & XHCI_STATE_HALTED)) {
3612 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
3613 kfree(command);
3614 return -ENODEV;
3615 }
3616
3617 ret = xhci_queue_slot_control(xhci, command, TRB_DISABLE_SLOT,
3618 slot_id);
3619 if (ret) {
3620 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
3621 kfree(command);
3622 return ret;
3623 }
3624 xhci_ring_cmd_db(xhci);
3625 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
3626 return ret;
3627}
3628
3629/*
3630 * Checks if we have enough host controller resources for the default control
3631 * endpoint.
3632 *
3633 * Must be called with xhci->lock held.
3634 */
3635static int xhci_reserve_host_control_ep_resources(struct xhci_hcd *xhci)
3636{
3637 if (xhci->num_active_eps + 1 > xhci->limit_active_eps) {
3638 xhci_dbg_trace(xhci, trace_xhci_dbg_quirks,
3639 "Not enough ep ctxs: "
3640 "%u active, need to add 1, limit is %u.",
3641 xhci->num_active_eps, xhci->limit_active_eps);
3642 return -ENOMEM;
3643 }
3644 xhci->num_active_eps += 1;
3645 xhci_dbg_trace(xhci, trace_xhci_dbg_quirks,
3646 "Adding 1 ep ctx, %u now active.",
3647 xhci->num_active_eps);
3648 return 0;
3649}
3650
3651
3652/*
3653 * Returns 0 if the xHC ran out of device slots, the Enable Slot command
3654 * timed out, or allocating memory failed. Returns 1 on success.
3655 */
3656int xhci_alloc_dev(struct usb_hcd *hcd, struct usb_device *udev)
3657{
3658 struct xhci_hcd *xhci = hcd_to_xhci(hcd);
3659 struct xhci_virt_device *vdev;
3660 struct xhci_slot_ctx *slot_ctx;
3661 unsigned long flags;
3662 int ret, slot_id;
3663 struct xhci_command *command;
3664
3665 command = xhci_alloc_command(xhci, false, true, GFP_KERNEL);
3666 if (!command)
3667 return 0;
3668
3669 /* xhci->slot_id and xhci->addr_dev are not thread-safe */
3670 mutex_lock(&xhci->mutex);
3671 spin_lock_irqsave(&xhci->lock, flags);
3672 ret = xhci_queue_slot_control(xhci, command, TRB_ENABLE_SLOT, 0);
3673 if (ret) {
3674 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
3675 mutex_unlock(&xhci->mutex);
3676 xhci_dbg(xhci, "FIXME: allocate a command ring segment\n");
3677 xhci_free_command(xhci, command);
3678 return 0;
3679 }
3680 xhci_ring_cmd_db(xhci);
3681 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
3682
3683 wait_for_completion(command->completion);
3684 slot_id = command->slot_id;
3685 mutex_unlock(&xhci->mutex);
3686
3687 if (!slot_id || command->status != COMP_SUCCESS) {
3688 xhci_err(xhci, "Error while assigning device slot ID\n");
3689 xhci_err(xhci, "Max number of devices this xHCI host supports is %u.\n",
3690 HCS_MAX_SLOTS(
3691 readl(&xhci->cap_regs->hcs_params1)));
3692 xhci_free_command(xhci, command);
3693 return 0;
3694 }
3695
3696 xhci_free_command(xhci, command);
3697
3698 if ((xhci->quirks & XHCI_EP_LIMIT_QUIRK)) {
3699 spin_lock_irqsave(&xhci->lock, flags);
3700 ret = xhci_reserve_host_control_ep_resources(xhci);
3701 if (ret) {
3702 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
3703 xhci_warn(xhci, "Not enough host resources, "
3704 "active endpoint contexts = %u\n",
3705 xhci->num_active_eps);
3706 goto disable_slot;
3707 }
3708 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
3709 }
3710 /* Use GFP_NOIO, since this function can be called from
3711 * xhci_discover_or_reset_device(), which may be called as part of
3712 * mass storage driver error handling.
3713 */
3714 if (!xhci_alloc_virt_device(xhci, slot_id, udev, GFP_NOIO)) {
3715 xhci_warn(xhci, "Could not allocate xHCI USB device data structures\n");
3716 goto disable_slot;
3717 }
3718 vdev = xhci->devs[slot_id];
3719 slot_ctx = xhci_get_slot_ctx(xhci, vdev->out_ctx);
3720 trace_xhci_alloc_dev(slot_ctx);
3721
3722 udev->slot_id = slot_id;
3723
3724#ifndef CONFIG_USB_DEFAULT_PERSIST
3725 /*
3726 * If resetting upon resume, we can't put the controller into runtime
3727 * suspend if there is a device attached.
3728 */
3729 if (xhci->quirks & XHCI_RESET_ON_RESUME)
3730 pm_runtime_get_noresume(hcd->self.controller);
3731#endif
3732
3733 /* Is this a LS or FS device under a HS hub? */
3734 /* Hub or peripherial? */
3735 return 1;
3736
3737disable_slot:
3738 return xhci_disable_slot(xhci, udev->slot_id);
3739}
3740
3741/*
3742 * Issue an Address Device command and optionally send a corresponding
3743 * SetAddress request to the device.
3744 */
3745static int xhci_setup_device(struct usb_hcd *hcd, struct usb_device *udev,
3746 enum xhci_setup_dev setup)
3747{
3748 const char *act = setup == SETUP_CONTEXT_ONLY ? "context" : "address";
3749 unsigned long flags;
3750 struct xhci_virt_device *virt_dev;
3751 int ret = 0;
3752 struct xhci_hcd *xhci = hcd_to_xhci(hcd);
3753 struct xhci_slot_ctx *slot_ctx;
3754 struct xhci_input_control_ctx *ctrl_ctx;
3755 u64 temp_64;
3756 struct xhci_command *command = NULL;
3757
3758 mutex_lock(&xhci->mutex);
3759
3760 if (xhci->xhc_state) { /* dying, removing or halted */
3761 ret = -ESHUTDOWN;
3762 goto out;
3763 }
3764
3765 if (!udev->slot_id) {
3766 xhci_dbg_trace(xhci, trace_xhci_dbg_address,
3767 "Bad Slot ID %d", udev->slot_id);
3768 ret = -EINVAL;
3769 goto out;
3770 }
3771
3772 virt_dev = xhci->devs[udev->slot_id];
3773
3774 if (WARN_ON(!virt_dev)) {
3775 /*
3776 * In plug/unplug torture test with an NEC controller,
3777 * a zero-dereference was observed once due to virt_dev = 0.
3778 * Print useful debug rather than crash if it is observed again!
3779 */
3780 xhci_warn(xhci, "Virt dev invalid for slot_id 0x%x!\n",
3781 udev->slot_id);
3782 ret = -EINVAL;
3783 goto out;
3784 }
3785 slot_ctx = xhci_get_slot_ctx(xhci, virt_dev->out_ctx);
3786 trace_xhci_setup_device_slot(slot_ctx);
3787
3788 if (setup == SETUP_CONTEXT_ONLY) {
3789 if (GET_SLOT_STATE(le32_to_cpu(slot_ctx->dev_state)) ==
3790 SLOT_STATE_DEFAULT) {
3791 xhci_dbg(xhci, "Slot already in default state\n");
3792 goto out;
3793 }
3794 }
3795
3796 command = xhci_alloc_command(xhci, false, true, GFP_KERNEL);
3797 if (!command) {
3798 ret = -ENOMEM;
3799 goto out;
3800 }
3801
3802 command->in_ctx = virt_dev->in_ctx;
3803
3804 slot_ctx = xhci_get_slot_ctx(xhci, virt_dev->in_ctx);
3805 ctrl_ctx = xhci_get_input_control_ctx(virt_dev->in_ctx);
3806 if (!ctrl_ctx) {
3807 xhci_warn(xhci, "%s: Could not get input context, bad type.\n",
3808 __func__);
3809 ret = -EINVAL;
3810 goto out;
3811 }
3812 /*
3813 * If this is the first Set Address since device plug-in or
3814 * virt_device realloaction after a resume with an xHCI power loss,
3815 * then set up the slot context.
3816 */
3817 if (!slot_ctx->dev_info)
3818 xhci_setup_addressable_virt_dev(xhci, udev);
3819 /* Otherwise, update the control endpoint ring enqueue pointer. */
3820 else
3821 xhci_copy_ep0_dequeue_into_input_ctx(xhci, udev);
3822 ctrl_ctx->add_flags = cpu_to_le32(SLOT_FLAG | EP0_FLAG);
3823 ctrl_ctx->drop_flags = 0;
3824
3825 trace_xhci_address_ctx(xhci, virt_dev->in_ctx,
3826 le32_to_cpu(slot_ctx->dev_info) >> 27);
3827
3828 spin_lock_irqsave(&xhci->lock, flags);
3829 trace_xhci_setup_device(virt_dev);
3830 ret = xhci_queue_address_device(xhci, command, virt_dev->in_ctx->dma,
3831 udev->slot_id, setup);
3832 if (ret) {
3833 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
3834 xhci_dbg_trace(xhci, trace_xhci_dbg_address,
3835 "FIXME: allocate a command ring segment");
3836 goto out;
3837 }
3838 xhci_ring_cmd_db(xhci);
3839 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
3840
3841 /* ctrl tx can take up to 5 sec; XXX: need more time for xHC? */
3842 wait_for_completion(command->completion);
3843
3844 /* FIXME: From section 4.3.4: "Software shall be responsible for timing
3845 * the SetAddress() "recovery interval" required by USB and aborting the
3846 * command on a timeout.
3847 */
3848 switch (command->status) {
3849 case COMP_COMMAND_ABORTED:
3850 case COMP_COMMAND_RING_STOPPED:
3851 xhci_warn(xhci, "Timeout while waiting for setup device command\n");
3852 ret = -ETIME;
3853 break;
3854 case COMP_CONTEXT_STATE_ERROR:
3855 case COMP_SLOT_NOT_ENABLED_ERROR:
3856 xhci_err(xhci, "Setup ERROR: setup %s command for slot %d.\n",
3857 act, udev->slot_id);
3858 ret = -EINVAL;
3859 break;
3860 case COMP_USB_TRANSACTION_ERROR:
3861 dev_warn(&udev->dev, "Device not responding to setup %s.\n", act);
3862 ret = -EPROTO;
3863 break;
3864 case COMP_INCOMPATIBLE_DEVICE_ERROR:
3865 dev_warn(&udev->dev,
3866 "ERROR: Incompatible device for setup %s command\n", act);
3867 ret = -ENODEV;
3868 break;
3869 case COMP_SUCCESS:
3870 xhci_dbg_trace(xhci, trace_xhci_dbg_address,
3871 "Successful setup %s command", act);
3872 break;
3873 default:
3874 xhci_err(xhci,
3875 "ERROR: unexpected setup %s command completion code 0x%x.\n",
3876 act, command->status);
3877 trace_xhci_address_ctx(xhci, virt_dev->out_ctx, 1);
3878 ret = -EINVAL;
3879 break;
3880 }
3881 if (ret)
3882 goto out;
3883 temp_64 = xhci_read_64(xhci, &xhci->op_regs->dcbaa_ptr);
3884 xhci_dbg_trace(xhci, trace_xhci_dbg_address,
3885 "Op regs DCBAA ptr = %#016llx", temp_64);
3886 xhci_dbg_trace(xhci, trace_xhci_dbg_address,
3887 "Slot ID %d dcbaa entry @%p = %#016llx",
3888 udev->slot_id,
3889 &xhci->dcbaa->dev_context_ptrs[udev->slot_id],
3890 (unsigned long long)
3891 le64_to_cpu(xhci->dcbaa->dev_context_ptrs[udev->slot_id]));
3892 xhci_dbg_trace(xhci, trace_xhci_dbg_address,
3893 "Output Context DMA address = %#08llx",
3894 (unsigned long long)virt_dev->out_ctx->dma);
3895 trace_xhci_address_ctx(xhci, virt_dev->in_ctx,
3896 le32_to_cpu(slot_ctx->dev_info) >> 27);
3897 /*
3898 * USB core uses address 1 for the roothubs, so we add one to the
3899 * address given back to us by the HC.
3900 */
3901 trace_xhci_address_ctx(xhci, virt_dev->out_ctx,
3902 le32_to_cpu(slot_ctx->dev_info) >> 27);
3903 /* Zero the input context control for later use */
3904 ctrl_ctx->add_flags = 0;
3905 ctrl_ctx->drop_flags = 0;
3906
3907 xhci_dbg_trace(xhci, trace_xhci_dbg_address,
3908 "Internal device address = %d",
3909 le32_to_cpu(slot_ctx->dev_state) & DEV_ADDR_MASK);
3910out:
3911 mutex_unlock(&xhci->mutex);
3912 if (command) {
3913 kfree(command->completion);
3914 kfree(command);
3915 }
3916 return ret;
3917}
3918
3919static int xhci_address_device(struct usb_hcd *hcd, struct usb_device *udev)
3920{
3921 return xhci_setup_device(hcd, udev, SETUP_CONTEXT_ADDRESS);
3922}
3923
3924static int xhci_enable_device(struct usb_hcd *hcd, struct usb_device *udev)
3925{
3926 return xhci_setup_device(hcd, udev, SETUP_CONTEXT_ONLY);
3927}
3928
3929/*
3930 * Transfer the port index into real index in the HW port status
3931 * registers. Caculate offset between the port's PORTSC register
3932 * and port status base. Divide the number of per port register
3933 * to get the real index. The raw port number bases 1.
3934 */
3935int xhci_find_raw_port_number(struct usb_hcd *hcd, int port1)
3936{
3937 struct xhci_hcd *xhci = hcd_to_xhci(hcd);
3938 __le32 __iomem *base_addr = &xhci->op_regs->port_status_base;
3939 __le32 __iomem *addr;
3940 int raw_port;
3941
3942 if (hcd->speed < HCD_USB3)
3943 addr = xhci->usb2_ports[port1 - 1];
3944 else
3945 addr = xhci->usb3_ports[port1 - 1];
3946
3947 raw_port = (addr - base_addr)/NUM_PORT_REGS + 1;
3948 return raw_port;
3949}
3950
3951/*
3952 * Issue an Evaluate Context command to change the Maximum Exit Latency in the
3953 * slot context. If that succeeds, store the new MEL in the xhci_virt_device.
3954 */
3955static int __maybe_unused xhci_change_max_exit_latency(struct xhci_hcd *xhci,
3956 struct usb_device *udev, u16 max_exit_latency)
3957{
3958 struct xhci_virt_device *virt_dev;
3959 struct xhci_command *command;
3960 struct xhci_input_control_ctx *ctrl_ctx;
3961 struct xhci_slot_ctx *slot_ctx;
3962 unsigned long flags;
3963 int ret;
3964
3965 spin_lock_irqsave(&xhci->lock, flags);
3966
3967 virt_dev = xhci->devs[udev->slot_id];
3968
3969 /*
3970 * virt_dev might not exists yet if xHC resumed from hibernate (S4) and
3971 * xHC was re-initialized. Exit latency will be set later after
3972 * hub_port_finish_reset() is done and xhci->devs[] are re-allocated
3973 */
3974
3975 if (!virt_dev || max_exit_latency == virt_dev->current_mel) {
3976 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
3977 return 0;
3978 }
3979
3980 /* Attempt to issue an Evaluate Context command to change the MEL. */
3981 command = xhci->lpm_command;
3982 ctrl_ctx = xhci_get_input_control_ctx(command->in_ctx);
3983 if (!ctrl_ctx) {
3984 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
3985 xhci_warn(xhci, "%s: Could not get input context, bad type.\n",
3986 __func__);
3987 return -ENOMEM;
3988 }
3989
3990 xhci_slot_copy(xhci, command->in_ctx, virt_dev->out_ctx);
3991 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
3992
3993 ctrl_ctx->add_flags |= cpu_to_le32(SLOT_FLAG);
3994 slot_ctx = xhci_get_slot_ctx(xhci, command->in_ctx);
3995 slot_ctx->dev_info2 &= cpu_to_le32(~((u32) MAX_EXIT));
3996 slot_ctx->dev_info2 |= cpu_to_le32(max_exit_latency);
3997 slot_ctx->dev_state = 0;
3998
3999 xhci_dbg_trace(xhci, trace_xhci_dbg_context_change,
4000 "Set up evaluate context for LPM MEL change.");
4001
4002 /* Issue and wait for the evaluate context command. */
4003 ret = xhci_configure_endpoint(xhci, udev, command,
4004 true, true);
4005
4006 if (!ret) {
4007 spin_lock_irqsave(&xhci->lock, flags);
4008 virt_dev->current_mel = max_exit_latency;
4009 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
4010 }
4011 return ret;
4012}
4013
4014#ifdef CONFIG_PM
4015
4016/* BESL to HIRD Encoding array for USB2 LPM */
4017static int xhci_besl_encoding[16] = {125, 150, 200, 300, 400, 500, 1000, 2000,
4018 3000, 4000, 5000, 6000, 7000, 8000, 9000, 10000};
4019
4020/* Calculate HIRD/BESL for USB2 PORTPMSC*/
4021static int xhci_calculate_hird_besl(struct xhci_hcd *xhci,
4022 struct usb_device *udev)
4023{
4024 int u2del, besl, besl_host;
4025 int besl_device = 0;
4026 u32 field;
4027
4028 u2del = HCS_U2_LATENCY(xhci->hcs_params3);
4029 field = le32_to_cpu(udev->bos->ext_cap->bmAttributes);
4030
4031 if (field & USB_BESL_SUPPORT) {
4032 for (besl_host = 0; besl_host < 16; besl_host++) {
4033 if (xhci_besl_encoding[besl_host] >= u2del)
4034 break;
4035 }
4036 /* Use baseline BESL value as default */
4037 if (field & USB_BESL_BASELINE_VALID)
4038 besl_device = USB_GET_BESL_BASELINE(field);
4039 else if (field & USB_BESL_DEEP_VALID)
4040 besl_device = USB_GET_BESL_DEEP(field);
4041 } else {
4042 if (u2del <= 50)
4043 besl_host = 0;
4044 else
4045 besl_host = (u2del - 51) / 75 + 1;
4046 }
4047
4048 besl = besl_host + besl_device;
4049 if (besl > 15)
4050 besl = 15;
4051
4052 return besl;
4053}
4054
4055/* Calculate BESLD, L1 timeout and HIRDM for USB2 PORTHLPMC */
4056static int xhci_calculate_usb2_hw_lpm_params(struct usb_device *udev)
4057{
4058 u32 field;
4059 int l1;
4060 int besld = 0;
4061 int hirdm = 0;
4062
4063 field = le32_to_cpu(udev->bos->ext_cap->bmAttributes);
4064
4065 /* xHCI l1 is set in steps of 256us, xHCI 1.0 section 5.4.11.2 */
4066 l1 = udev->l1_params.timeout / 256;
4067
4068 /* device has preferred BESLD */
4069 if (field & USB_BESL_DEEP_VALID) {
4070 besld = USB_GET_BESL_DEEP(field);
4071 hirdm = 1;
4072 }
4073
4074 return PORT_BESLD(besld) | PORT_L1_TIMEOUT(l1) | PORT_HIRDM(hirdm);
4075}
4076
4077static int xhci_set_usb2_hardware_lpm(struct usb_hcd *hcd,
4078 struct usb_device *udev, int enable)
4079{
4080 struct xhci_hcd *xhci = hcd_to_xhci(hcd);
4081 __le32 __iomem **port_array;
4082 __le32 __iomem *pm_addr, *hlpm_addr;
4083 u32 pm_val, hlpm_val, field;
4084 unsigned int port_num;
4085 unsigned long flags;
4086 int hird, exit_latency;
4087 int ret;
4088
4089 if (hcd->speed >= HCD_USB3 || !xhci->hw_lpm_support ||
4090 !udev->lpm_capable)
4091 return -EPERM;
4092
4093 if (!udev->parent || udev->parent->parent ||
4094 udev->descriptor.bDeviceClass == USB_CLASS_HUB)
4095 return -EPERM;
4096
4097 if (udev->usb2_hw_lpm_capable != 1)
4098 return -EPERM;
4099
4100 spin_lock_irqsave(&xhci->lock, flags);
4101
4102 port_array = xhci->usb2_ports;
4103 port_num = udev->portnum - 1;
4104 pm_addr = port_array[port_num] + PORTPMSC;
4105 pm_val = readl(pm_addr);
4106 hlpm_addr = port_array[port_num] + PORTHLPMC;
4107 field = le32_to_cpu(udev->bos->ext_cap->bmAttributes);
4108
4109 xhci_dbg(xhci, "%s port %d USB2 hardware LPM\n",
4110 enable ? "enable" : "disable", port_num + 1);
4111
4112 if (enable) {
4113 /* Host supports BESL timeout instead of HIRD */
4114 if (udev->usb2_hw_lpm_besl_capable) {
4115 /* if device doesn't have a preferred BESL value use a
4116 * default one which works with mixed HIRD and BESL
4117 * systems. See XHCI_DEFAULT_BESL definition in xhci.h
4118 */
4119 if ((field & USB_BESL_SUPPORT) &&
4120 (field & USB_BESL_BASELINE_VALID))
4121 hird = USB_GET_BESL_BASELINE(field);
4122 else
4123 hird = udev->l1_params.besl;
4124
4125 exit_latency = xhci_besl_encoding[hird];
4126 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
4127
4128 /* USB 3.0 code dedicate one xhci->lpm_command->in_ctx
4129 * input context for link powermanagement evaluate
4130 * context commands. It is protected by hcd->bandwidth
4131 * mutex and is shared by all devices. We need to set
4132 * the max ext latency in USB 2 BESL LPM as well, so
4133 * use the same mutex and xhci_change_max_exit_latency()
4134 */
4135 mutex_lock(hcd->bandwidth_mutex);
4136 ret = xhci_change_max_exit_latency(xhci, udev,
4137 exit_latency);
4138 mutex_unlock(hcd->bandwidth_mutex);
4139
4140 if (ret < 0)
4141 return ret;
4142 spin_lock_irqsave(&xhci->lock, flags);
4143
4144 hlpm_val = xhci_calculate_usb2_hw_lpm_params(udev);
4145 writel(hlpm_val, hlpm_addr);
4146 /* flush write */
4147 readl(hlpm_addr);
4148 } else {
4149 hird = xhci_calculate_hird_besl(xhci, udev);
4150 }
4151
4152 pm_val &= ~PORT_HIRD_MASK;
4153 pm_val |= PORT_HIRD(hird) | PORT_RWE | PORT_L1DS(udev->slot_id);
4154 writel(pm_val, pm_addr);
4155 pm_val = readl(pm_addr);
4156 pm_val |= PORT_HLE;
4157 writel(pm_val, pm_addr);
4158 /* flush write */
4159 readl(pm_addr);
4160 } else {
4161 pm_val &= ~(PORT_HLE | PORT_RWE | PORT_HIRD_MASK | PORT_L1DS_MASK);
4162 writel(pm_val, pm_addr);
4163 /* flush write */
4164 readl(pm_addr);
4165 if (udev->usb2_hw_lpm_besl_capable) {
4166 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
4167 mutex_lock(hcd->bandwidth_mutex);
4168 xhci_change_max_exit_latency(xhci, udev, 0);
4169 mutex_unlock(hcd->bandwidth_mutex);
4170 return 0;
4171 }
4172 }
4173
4174 spin_unlock_irqrestore(&xhci->lock, flags);
4175 return 0;
4176}
4177
4178/* check if a usb2 port supports a given extened capability protocol
4179 * only USB2 ports extended protocol capability values are cached.
4180 * Return 1 if capability is supported
4181 */
4182static int xhci_check_usb2_port_capability(struct xhci_hcd *xhci, int port,
4183 unsigned capability)
4184{
4185 u32 port_offset, port_count;
4186 int i;
4187
4188 for (i = 0; i < xhci->num_ext_caps; i++) {
4189 if (xhci->ext_caps[i] & capability) {
4190 /* port offsets starts at 1 */
4191 port_offset = XHCI_EXT_PORT_OFF(xhci->ext_caps[i]) - 1;
4192 port_count = XHCI_EXT_PORT_COUNT(xhci->ext_caps[i]);
4193 if (port >= port_offset &&
4194 port < port_offset + port_count)
4195 return 1;
4196 }
4197 }
4198 return 0;
4199}
4200
4201static int xhci_update_device(struct usb_hcd *hcd, struct usb_device *udev)
4202{
4203 struct xhci_hcd *xhci = hcd_to_xhci(hcd);
4204 int portnum = udev->portnum - 1;
4205
4206 if (hcd->speed >= HCD_USB3 || !xhci->sw_lpm_support ||
4207 !udev->lpm_capable)
4208 return 0;
4209
4210 /* we only support lpm for non-hub device connected to root hub yet */
4211 if (!udev->parent || udev->parent->parent ||
4212 udev->descriptor.bDeviceClass == USB_CLASS_HUB)
4213 return 0;
4214
4215 if (xhci->hw_lpm_support == 1 &&
4216 xhci_check_usb2_port_capability(
4217 xhci, portnum, XHCI_HLC)) {
4218 udev->usb2_hw_lpm_capable = 1;
4219 udev->l1_params.timeout = XHCI_L1_TIMEOUT;
4220 udev->l1_params.besl = XHCI_DEFAULT_BESL;
4221 if (xhci_check_usb2_port_capability(xhci, portnum,
4222 XHCI_BLC))
4223 udev->usb2_hw_lpm_besl_capable = 1;
4224 }
4225
4226 return 0;
4227}
4228
4229/*---------------------- USB 3.0 Link PM functions ------------------------*/
4230
4231/* Service interval in nanoseconds = 2^(bInterval - 1) * 125us * 1000ns / 1us */
4232static unsigned long long xhci_service_interval_to_ns(
4233 struct usb_endpoint_descriptor *desc)
4234{
4235 return (1ULL << (desc->bInterval - 1)) * 125 * 1000;
4236}
4237
4238static u16 xhci_get_timeout_no_hub_lpm(struct usb_device *udev,
4239 enum usb3_link_state state)
4240{
4241 unsigned long long sel;
4242 unsigned long long pel;
4243 unsigned int max_sel_pel;
4244 char *state_name;
4245
4246 switch (state) {
4247 case USB3_LPM_U1:
4248 /* Convert SEL and PEL stored in nanoseconds to microseconds */
4249 sel = DIV_ROUND_UP(udev->u1_params.sel, 1000);
4250 pel = DIV_ROUND_UP(udev->u1_params.pel, 1000);
4251 max_sel_pel = USB3_LPM_MAX_U1_SEL_PEL;
4252 state_name = "U1";
4253 break;
4254 case USB3_LPM_U2:
4255 sel = DIV_ROUND_UP(udev->u2_params.sel, 1000);
4256 pel = DIV_ROUND_UP(udev->u2_params.pel, 1000);
4257 max_sel_pel = USB3_LPM_MAX_U2_SEL_PEL;
4258 state_name = "U2";
4259 break;
4260 default:
4261 dev_warn(&udev->dev, "%s: Can't get timeout for non-U1 or U2 state.\n",
4262 __func__);
4263 return USB3_LPM_DISABLED;
4264 }
4265
4266 if (sel <= max_sel_pel && pel <= max_sel_pel)
4267 return USB3_LPM_DEVICE_INITIATED;
4268
4269 if (sel > max_sel_pel)
4270 dev_dbg(&udev->dev, "Device-initiated %s disabled "
4271 "due to long SEL %llu ms\n",
4272 state_name, sel);
4273 else
4274 dev_dbg(&udev->dev, "Device-initiated %s disabled "
4275 "due to long PEL %llu ms\n",
4276 state_name, pel);
4277 return USB3_LPM_DISABLED;
4278}
4279
4280/* The U1 timeout should be the maximum of the following values:
4281 * - For control endpoints, U1 system exit latency (SEL) * 3
4282 * - For bulk endpoints, U1 SEL * 5
4283 * - For interrupt endpoints:
4284 * - Notification EPs, U1 SEL * 3
4285 * - Periodic EPs, max(105% of bInterval, U1 SEL * 2)
4286 * - For isochronous endpoints, max(105% of bInterval, U1 SEL * 2)
4287 */
4288static unsigned long long xhci_calculate_intel_u1_timeout(
4289 struct usb_device *udev,
4290 struct usb_endpoint_descriptor *desc)
4291{
4292 unsigned long long timeout_ns;
4293 int ep_type;
4294 int intr_type;
4295
4296 ep_type = usb_endpoint_type(desc);
4297 switch (ep_type) {
4298 case USB_ENDPOINT_XFER_CONTROL:
4299 timeout_ns = udev->u1_params.sel * 3;
4300 break;
4301 case USB_ENDPOINT_XFER_BULK:
4302 timeout_ns = udev->u1_params.sel * 5;
4303 break;
4304 case USB_ENDPOINT_XFER_INT:
4305 intr_type = usb_endpoint_interrupt_type(desc);
4306 if (intr_type == USB_ENDPOINT_INTR_NOTIFICATION) {
4307 timeout_ns = udev->u1_params.sel * 3;
4308 break;
4309 }
4310 /* Otherwise the calculation is the same as isoc eps */
4311 case USB_ENDPOINT_XFER_ISOC:
4312 timeout_ns = xhci_service_interval_to_ns(desc);
4313 timeout_ns = DIV_ROUND_UP_ULL(timeout_ns * 105, 100);
4314 if (timeout_ns < udev->u1_params.sel * 2)
4315 timeout_ns = udev->u1_params.sel * 2;
4316 break;
4317 default:
4318 return 0;
4319 }
4320
4321 return timeout_ns;
4322}
4323
4324/* Returns the hub-encoded U1 timeout value. */
4325static u16 xhci_calculate_u1_timeout(struct xhci_hcd *xhci,
4326 struct usb_device *udev,
4327 struct usb_endpoint_descriptor *desc)
4328{
4329 unsigned long long timeout_ns;
4330
4331 if (xhci->quirks & XHCI_INTEL_HOST)
4332 timeout_ns = xhci_calculate_intel_u1_timeout(udev, desc);
4333 else
4334 timeout_ns = udev->u1_params.sel;
4335
4336 /* The U1 timeout is encoded in 1us intervals.
4337 * Don't return a timeout of zero, because that's USB3_LPM_DISABLED.
4338 */
4339 if (timeout_ns == USB3_LPM_DISABLED)
4340 timeout_ns = 1;
4341 else
4342 timeout_ns = DIV_ROUND_UP_ULL(timeout_ns, 1000);
4343
4344 /* If the necessary timeout value is bigger than what we can set in the
4345 * USB 3.0 hub, we have to disable hub-initiated U1.
4346 */
4347 if (timeout_ns <= USB3_LPM_U1_MAX_TIMEOUT)
4348 return timeout_ns;
4349 dev_dbg(&udev->dev, "Hub-initiated U1 disabled "
4350 "due to long timeout %llu ms\n", timeout_ns);
4351 return xhci_get_timeout_no_hub_lpm(udev, USB3_LPM_U1);
4352}
4353
4354/* The U2 timeout should be the maximum of:
4355 * - 10 ms (to avoid the bandwidth impact on the scheduler)
4356 * - largest bInterval of any active periodic endpoint (to avoid going
4357 * into lower power link states between intervals).
4358 * - the U2 Exit Latency of the device
4359 */
4360static unsigned long long xhci_calculate_intel_u2_timeout(
4361 struct usb_device *udev,
4362 struct usb_endpoint_descriptor *desc)
4363{
4364 unsigned long long timeout_ns;
4365 unsigned long long u2_del_ns;
4366
4367 timeout_ns = 10 * 1000 * 1000;
4368
4369 if ((usb_endpoint_xfer_int(desc) || usb_endpoint_xfer_isoc(desc)) &&
4370 (xhci_service_interval_to_ns(desc) > timeout_ns))
4371 timeout_ns = xhci_service_interval_to_ns(desc);
4372
4373 u2_del_ns = le16_to_cpu(udev->bos->ss_cap->bU2DevExitLat) * 1000ULL;
4374 if (u2_del_ns > timeout_ns)
4375 timeout_ns = u2_del_ns;
4376
4377 return timeout_ns;
4378}
4379
4380/* Returns the hub-encoded U2 timeout value. */
4381static u16 xhci_calculate_u2_timeout(struct xhci_hcd *xhci,
4382 struct usb_device *udev,
4383 struct usb_endpoint_descriptor *desc)
4384{
4385 unsigned long long timeout_ns;
4386
4387 if (xhci->quirks & XHCI_INTEL_HOST)
4388 timeout_ns = xhci_calculate_intel_u2_timeout(udev, desc);
4389 else
4390 timeout_ns = udev->u2_params.sel;
4391
4392 /* The U2 timeout is encoded in 256us intervals */
4393 timeout_ns = DIV_ROUND_UP_ULL(timeout_ns, 256 * 1000);
4394 /* If the necessary timeout value is bigger than what we can set in the
4395 * USB 3.0 hub, we have to disable hub-initiated U2.
4396 */
4397 if (timeout_ns <= USB3_LPM_U2_MAX_TIMEOUT)
4398 return timeout_ns;
4399 dev_dbg(&udev->dev, "Hub-initiated U2 disabled "
4400 "due to long timeout %llu ms\n", timeout_ns);
4401 return xhci_get_timeout_no_hub_lpm(udev, USB3_LPM_U2);
4402}
4403
4404static u16 xhci_call_host_update_timeout_for_endpoint(struct xhci_hcd *xhci,
4405 struct usb_device *udev,
4406 struct usb_endpoint_descriptor *desc,
4407 enum usb3_link_state state,
4408 u16 *timeout)
4409{
4410 if (state == USB3_LPM_U1)
4411 return xhci_calculate_u1_timeout(xhci, udev, desc);
4412 else if (state == USB3_LPM_U2)
4413 return xhci_calculate_u2_timeout(xhci, udev, desc);
4414
4415 return USB3_LPM_DISABLED;
4416}
4417
4418static int xhci_update_timeout_for_endpoint(struct xhci_hcd *xhci,
4419 struct usb_device *udev,
4420 struct usb_endpoint_descriptor *desc,
4421 enum usb3_link_state state,
4422 u16 *timeout)
4423{
4424 u16 alt_timeout;
4425
4426 alt_timeout = xhci_call_host_update_timeout_for_endpoint(xhci, udev,
4427 desc, state, timeout);
4428
4429 /* If we found we can't enable hub-initiated LPM, or
4430 * the U1 or U2 exit latency was too high to allow
4431 * device-initiated LPM as well, just stop searching.
4432 */
4433 if (alt_timeout == USB3_LPM_DISABLED ||
4434 alt_timeout == USB3_LPM_DEVICE_INITIATED) {
4435 *timeout = alt_timeout;
4436 return -E2BIG;
4437 }
4438 if (alt_timeout > *timeout)
4439 *timeout = alt_timeout;
4440 return 0;
4441}
4442
4443static int xhci_update_timeout_for_interface(struct xhci_hcd *xhci,
4444 struct usb_device *udev,
4445 struct usb_host_interface *alt,
4446 enum usb3_link_state state,
4447 u16 *timeout)
4448{
4449 int j;
4450
4451 for (j = 0; j < alt->desc.bNumEndpoints; j++) {
4452 if (xhci_update_timeout_for_endpoint(xhci, udev,
4453 &alt->endpoint[j].desc, state, timeout))
4454 return -E2BIG;
4455 continue;
4456 }
4457 return 0;
4458}
4459
4460static int xhci_check_intel_tier_policy(struct usb_device *udev,
4461 enum usb3_link_state state)
4462{
4463 struct usb_device *parent;
4464 unsigned int num_hubs;
4465
4466 if (state == USB3_LPM_U2)
4467 return 0;
4468
4469 /* Don't enable U1 if the device is on a 2nd tier hub or lower. */
4470 for (parent = udev->parent, num_hubs = 0; parent->parent;
4471 parent = parent->parent)
4472 num_hubs++;
4473
4474 if (num_hubs < 2)
4475 return 0;
4476
4477 dev_dbg(&udev->dev, "Disabling U1 link state for device"
4478 " below second-tier hub.\n");
4479 dev_dbg(&udev->dev, "Plug device into first-tier hub "
4480 "to decrease power consumption.\n");
4481 return -E2BIG;
4482}
4483
4484static int xhci_check_tier_policy(struct xhci_hcd *xhci,
4485 struct usb_device *udev,
4486 enum usb3_link_state state)
4487{
4488 if (xhci->quirks & XHCI_INTEL_HOST)
4489 return xhci_check_intel_tier_policy(udev, state);
4490 else
4491 return 0;
4492}
4493
4494/* Returns the U1 or U2 timeout that should be enabled.
4495 * If the tier check or timeout setting functions return with a non-zero exit
4496 * code, that means the timeout value has been finalized and we shouldn't look
4497 * at any more endpoints.
4498 */
4499static u16 xhci_calculate_lpm_timeout(struct usb_hcd *hcd,
4500 struct usb_device *udev, enum usb3_link_state state)
4501{
4502 struct xhci_hcd *xhci = hcd_to_xhci(hcd);
4503 struct usb_host_config *config;
4504 char *state_name;
4505 int i;
4506 u16 timeout = USB3_LPM_DISABLED;
4507
4508 if (state == USB3_LPM_U1)
4509 state_name = "U1";
4510 else if (state == USB3_LPM_U2)
4511 state_name = "U2";
4512 else {
4513 dev_warn(&udev->dev, "Can't enable unknown link state %i\n",
4514 state);
4515 return timeout;
4516 }
4517
4518 if (xhci_check_tier_policy(xhci, udev, state) < 0)
4519 return timeout;
4520
4521 /* Gather some information about the currently installed configuration
4522 * and alternate interface settings.
4523 */
4524 if (xhci_update_timeout_for_endpoint(xhci, udev, &udev->ep0.desc,
4525 state, &timeout))
4526 return timeout;
4527
4528 config = udev->actconfig;
4529 if (!config)
4530 return timeout;
4531
4532 for (i = 0; i < config->desc.bNumInterfaces; i++) {
4533 struct usb_driver *driver;
4534 struct usb_interface *intf = config->interface[i];
4535
4536 if (!intf)
4537 continue;
4538
4539 /* Check if any currently bound drivers want hub-initiated LPM
4540 * disabled.
4541 */
4542 if (intf->dev.driver) {
4543 driver = to_usb_driver(intf->dev.driver);
4544 if (driver && driver->disable_hub_initiated_lpm) {
4545 dev_dbg(&udev->dev, "Hub-initiated %s disabled "
4546 "at request of driver %s\n",
4547 state_name, driver->name);
4548 return xhci_get_timeout_no_hub_lpm(udev, state);
4549 }
4550 }
4551
4552 /* Not sure how this could happen... */
4553 if (!intf->cur_altsetting)
4554 continue;
4555
4556 if (xhci_update_timeout_for_interface(xhci, udev,
4557 intf->cur_altsetting,
4558 state, &timeout))
4559 return timeout;
4560 }
4561 return timeout;
4562}
4563
4564static int calculate_max_exit_latency(struct usb_device *udev,
4565 enum usb3_link_state state_changed,
4566 u16 hub_encoded_timeout)
4567{
4568 unsigned long long u1_mel_us = 0;
4569 unsigned long long u2_mel_us = 0;
4570 unsigned long long mel_us = 0;
4571 bool disabling_u1;
4572 bool disabling_u2;
4573 bool enabling_u1;
4574 bool enabling_u2;
4575
4576 disabling_u1 = (state_changed == USB3_LPM_U1 &&
4577 hub_encoded_timeout == USB3_LPM_DISABLED);
4578 disabling_u2 = (state_changed == USB3_LPM_U2 &&
4579 hub_encoded_timeout == USB3_LPM_DISABLED);
4580
4581 enabling_u1 = (state_changed == USB3_LPM_U1 &&
4582 hub_encoded_timeout != USB3_LPM_DISABLED);
4583 enabling_u2 = (state_changed == USB3_LPM_U2 &&
4584 hub_encoded_timeout != USB3_LPM_DISABLED);
4585
4586 /* If U1 was already enabled and we're not disabling it,
4587 * or we're going to enable U1, account for the U1 max exit latency.
4588 */
4589 if ((udev->u1_params.timeout != USB3_LPM_DISABLED && !disabling_u1) ||
4590 enabling_u1)
4591 u1_mel_us = DIV_ROUND_UP(udev->u1_params.mel, 1000);
4592 if ((udev->u2_params.timeout != USB3_LPM_DISABLED && !disabling_u2) ||
4593 enabling_u2)
4594 u2_mel_us = DIV_ROUND_UP(udev->u2_params.mel, 1000);
4595
4596 if (u1_mel_us > u2_mel_us)
4597 mel_us = u1_mel_us;
4598 else
4599 mel_us = u2_mel_us;
4600 /* xHCI host controller max exit latency field is only 16 bits wide. */
4601 if (mel_us > MAX_EXIT) {
4602 dev_warn(&udev->dev, "Link PM max exit latency of %lluus "
4603 "is too big.\n", mel_us);
4604 return -E2BIG;
4605 }
4606 return mel_us;
4607}
4608
4609/* Returns the USB3 hub-encoded value for the U1/U2 timeout. */
4610static int xhci_enable_usb3_lpm_timeout(struct usb_hcd *hcd,
4611 struct usb_device *udev, enum usb3_link_state state)
4612{
4613 struct xhci_hcd *xhci;
4614 u16 hub_encoded_timeout;
4615 int mel;
4616 int ret;
4617
4618 xhci = hcd_to_xhci(hcd);
4619 /* The LPM timeout values are pretty host-controller specific, so don't
4620 * enable hub-initiated timeouts unless the vendor has provided
4621 * information about their timeout algorithm.
4622 */
4623 if (!xhci || !(xhci->quirks & XHCI_LPM_SUPPORT) ||
4624 !xhci->devs[udev->slot_id])
4625 return USB3_LPM_DISABLED;
4626
4627 hub_encoded_timeout = xhci_calculate_lpm_timeout(hcd, udev, state);
4628 mel = calculate_max_exit_latency(udev, state, hub_encoded_timeout);
4629 if (mel < 0) {
4630 /* Max Exit Latency is too big, disable LPM. */
4631 hub_encoded_timeout = USB3_LPM_DISABLED;
4632 mel = 0;
4633 }
4634
4635 ret = xhci_change_max_exit_latency(xhci, udev, mel);
4636 if (ret)
4637 return ret;
4638 return hub_encoded_timeout;
4639}
4640
4641static int xhci_disable_usb3_lpm_timeout(struct usb_hcd *hcd,
4642 struct usb_device *udev, enum usb3_link_state state)
4643{
4644 struct xhci_hcd *xhci;
4645 u16 mel;
4646
4647 xhci = hcd_to_xhci(hcd);
4648 if (!xhci || !(xhci->quirks & XHCI_LPM_SUPPORT) ||
4649 !xhci->devs[udev->slot_id])
4650 return 0;
4651
4652 mel = calculate_max_exit_latency(udev, state, USB3_LPM_DISABLED);
4653 return xhci_change_max_exit_latency(xhci, udev, mel);
4654}
4655#else /* CONFIG_PM */
